config.question: According to Abraham Lincoln, the only justification of war was the struggle to __________.

choices.content: uphold the supremacy of the white race
secure the sovereignty of a nation threatened by external forces
ensure the economic health of a nation
preserve and extend the democratic ideal

answer_3.response: Consider This: To Lincoln, the issue in the conflict was nothing less than the survival of the kind of political system that gave men like himself a chance for high office. He wanted to ensure that “government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the earth.” See L.O. 15.3 How did the Union finally attain victory, and what role did emancipation play in it?
